PvSTATEM 0.0.1

    • Simple example of basic PvSTATEM package pre-release version functionalities

    Plate

    Plate.Rd

    A class to represent the luminex plate. It contains information about the samples and analytes that were examined on the plate as well as some additional metadata and batch info

    Value

    sample object of given sample name or id

    analyte id of given name

    Public fields

    analytes

    list of all analytes measured during an examination

    samples

    list of all samples examined on a plate

    batch_info

    a raw list containing all the metadata about the plate read from the Luminex file

    calibration_info

    a list containing calibration logs read from Luminex file

    audit_logs

    a list containing audit logs read from Luminex file

    Active bindings

    number_of_samples

    number of samples stored in the current plate

    analyte_names

    list of all analyte names saved in the plate

    sample_names

    list of all sample names

    examination_date

    Metadata: date of the examination

    batch_name

    Metdata: batch name

    min_events_per_bead

    minimal number of events that is valid for one bead - sample and analyte

    check_if_blanks_already_adjusted

    flag that specifies if the blanks were already adjusted and its MFI values subtracted from remaining samples

    warnings

    list of lists of all warnings from all samples

    errors

    list of lists of all errors from all samples

    Methods

    Public methods

    • Plate$new()

    • Plate$print()

    Method new()

    creates a new Plate object

    Usage

    Plate$new(
  analytes = list(),
  samples = list(),
  batch_info = list(),
  calibration_info = list(),
  audit_logs = list()
)

    Arguments

    analytes

    (list) list of all analytes measured during an examination

    samples

    (list) list of all samples examined on a plate

    batch_info

    (list)
    a raw list containing all the metadata about the plate read from the Luminex file

    calibration_info

    (list)
    a list containing calibration logs read from Luminex file

    audit_logs

    (list) a list containing audit logs read from Luminex file

    Method print()

    Usage

    Plate$print(...)

    Method summary()

    Function outputs basic information about the plate, such as examination date, batch name, and sample types

    Usage

    Plate$summary(..., include_names = FALSE)

    Arguments

    include_names

    If include_names parameter is TRUE, apart from count of control samples, provides also their names.By default FALSE

    Method add_results_block()

    function adds block of information to the current plate

    the analysis type should be added after the analysis, otherwise there is no enough information about samples

    Usage

    Plate$add_results_block(data_type, parsed_block)

    Method check_batch_info()

    Function verifies if the batch info contain valid information

    Usage

    Plate$check_batch_info()

    Method check_analyte_consistency()

    checks analyte consistency - verifies if all of the analytes contained within the samples are listed in the analytes list of the plate object

    Usage

    Plate$check_analyte_consistency()

    Method check_beads_number()

    function performs validity check - verifies which samples and analytes saved in the plate have the bead count lower than min_events_per_bead

    Usage

    Plate$check_beads_number(min_events_per_bead = self$min_events_per_bead)

    Arguments

    min_events_per_bead

    lower bound of acceptable number of events. By default equals to min_events_per_bead parameter saved in the plate object

    Method get_sample()

    Usage

    Plate$get_sample(sample)

    Arguments

    sample

    sample name or its id

    Method get_sample_by_type()

    Function returns list of samples filtered by the type

    Usage

    Plate$get_sample_by_type(sample_type, exclude = FALSE)

    Arguments

    sample_type

    type of the sample to be filtered. Possible values are: SampleType$valid_sample_types

    exclude

    If FALSE returns list of samples with given sample_type, otherwise returns all samples except for the specified sample_type

    Method get_analyte_id()

    Usage

    Plate$get_analyte_id(analyte_name)

    Method get()

    Function returns data for a specific analyte and sample.

    Usage

    Plate$get(analyte, sample, data_type = NULL)

    Arguments

    analyte

    An analyte name or its id of which data we want to extract

    sample

    sample name or id

    data_type

    if NULL returns whole column of the dataframe containing information about the sample. Otherwise tries to select the exact data_type from the dataframe and returns a single value

    Returns

    Data about a sample and analyte

    Method blank_adjustment()

    Function adjusts the values of test samples substracting values from BLANK samples to remove background light In short it substracts the values from data in all samples, except from Blanks. It does not substract values from Count values

    Usage

    Plate$blank_adjustment(method = "avg", inplace = "TRUE")

    Arguments

    method

    How the values of different blanks should be aggregated. By default avg. For now it is the only available method

    inplace

    Whether the method should produce new plate with adjusted values or not, By default TRUE - operates on the current plate.

    Method check_MFI_after_adjustment()

    Function verifies if there are any MFI values below zero after blank removal

    Usage

    Plate$check_MFI_after_adjustment()

    Method copy()

    performs copy of the plate

    Usage

    Plate$copy()

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    Plate$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.
